channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report E-2024110491
item.description:
Report E-2024110491

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0740 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at UPO. It was reported that approximately 2 cups of Enforce LP released from (1) 5-Gallon plastic pail due to improper loading at the previous terminal. The release impacted trailer, no storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (product is a class 8 corrosive) SCM stated the terminal personnel will complete the cleanup. The terminal used a 20-Gallon poly drum for the waste.

item.title: Report E-2024110467
item.description:
Report E-2024110467

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GMES) to remediate the impacted site. GMES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1210-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 85-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report X-2024110649
item.description:
Report X-2024110649

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-20T12:31:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/7/24, BNSF Portland IMF notified LARS of destination container RNLU 100043 (billed hazardous), found to be actively leaking. Unit was d eramped and moved into the Safe Haven for containment. Upon inspection by US Ecology, it was confirmed to be a hazardous leak, observed approximately 5 gallons of Millwork Treatment (UN3082) leaked out the of a cracked IBC Tote. Leak was caused by a lack of securement and a heavier spool shifting on top of the tote creating a hole, causing the leak. US Ecology remediated everything on the concrete, including the wastewater in the Haz Pit.
